name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Ft. Lauderdale Plantation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel the night of February 21, and I have to say that our experience was extremely positive. The room was not ready when we arrived, but we arrived before their listed check-in time of 1:00 pm, so this was to be expected. Actually, 1pm is early in comparison with other hotels I've stayed at. Most don't allow check-in until 3:00 pm. Regardless, the nice guy at the front desk called housekeeping and had them drop everything and clean our room next to minimize the waiting time (only 15 minutes or so). The room was cozy and the bed comfortable. We had access to both wired and wireless Internet (though we were never sure whether the wireless was the hotel's or someone's in the neighborhood). Breakfast is included with fresh muffins and danish, a waffle maker, coffee, juice and assorted flavors of tea. The landscaping around the hotel is lovely, and there were tables outside in a tropical setting near a pretty gazebo (as well as indoor seating). Little touches like a thank you note from the Manager along with a big chocolate chunk cookie and a bottle of water in the room were appreciated. We also received email upon checkout from the Manager asking about our stay. I wrote back with my one and only complaint (the awful coffee that was served) but all in all it was a great value for the price as compared to other area hotels who were charging twice the price due to the season. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonably-priced, clean, pleasant hotel. By the way, there were literally dozens of restaurants within a two block radius of the hotel.
reviews.title: Very comfortable - Nice Atmosphere

reviews.text: First, check in took nearly an hour, and we were lucky. There was another group there before us who waited several hours to get checked in. The staff was very slow and not very helpful. We had registered for non-smoking rooms--but were given smoking rooms. We were told that they couldn't do anything about it because they were full. One of the rooms smelled of cigarette smoke and was surrounded by rooms with barking dogs. Another room smelled very strongly of cleaning fluid. The internet service did not work in another room. We will never return to this hotel. There are many great places to stay in this area. Stay away from this hotel. Contrary to all the signs everywhere, no one cares about guest satisfaction.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: My family and I recently stayed at La Quinta Inn for a family function we were attending nearby. I can't write about my experience checking in because my brother checked us all in but the check out was pleasant and quick. The rooms are definitely showing signs of aging and the beds were ok, not as comfortable as I'm used to. Couldn't quite figure out the AC but that could have totally been us. It would shut off at night but as soon as we opened the curtains and let the sun in in the morning, the AC would kick on. Weird. Breakfast was ok, basic continental with waffles. Luckily we only paid $59 for the night because my brother used some discount coupons he found in the local gas station. Regular rate for this room would have been double what we paid and there's no way this hotel is worth more than the $59 we paid. Maybe if they upgrade it, I'd be willing to pay more. It was fine for the money we paid.
reviews.title: Decent Place, Getting a Little Worn

reviews.text: If ever in the area again and the price is $59, I won't hesitate to stay there.
reviews.title: fantastic location for shopping

reviews.text: This hotel was very clean. The staff on reception were very friendly and booked us in without any problems. The room was quite large with a nice large bathroom and quiet air conditioning. The hotel also has a good fitness room and the pool area is very nice with an array of tropical plants and palm trees.
reviews.title: Repeat customer

reviews.text: I stayed at the Laquinta Inn and Suites in Plantation over the Xmas holidays. The place was very nice and clean! The room was very clean and the staff was very nice. Arriving from an 11 hours flight from Paris I was very tired and they were very nice and had everything ready. Reservations and etc. was there no problem with check in at all and it was late at night after 10 pm. Only a few blocks away is a mall and the hotel is located off a main intersection and there wasnt no noise at all. The daily breakfast was very decent and nice. It was very clean and for the price you can't beat it. I will stay there again I was very pleased !!!! Good Job Laquinta Inn and Suites !!
reviews.title: very nice
Great Headquarters Room
reviews.text: I was here the last of June 2004 attending my granddaughter's wedding. Since I am elderly, I had reserved a ground floor room for one person. They had none left so had to give me a suite with king-size bed, refrigerator, coffepot & coffee, sofa and extra chairs!! My entire family (7 others) stayed in this motel and used my room for family get-togethers and a meeting room! The motel had an excellent breakfast room and food and drinks were great. Hot tub and pool were wonderful. The grounds were well-landscaped. I can't remember about the exercise room as we didn't use it. The furniture and other supplies were above average. The visit was very pleasant.

reviews.title: absolutely terrible
reviews.text: Rosalie from Virginia

I stayed at this hotel based on its location. Unfortunately, its convenience for me---workwise---was outweighed by the bad experience. The staff is poor. They are not helpful, nor ar they very well educated in any of the most basic elements of customer service. Do not expect helpfulness at this hotel. I booked online for a nonsmoking room. To my suprise I was given a smoking room. Well, i don't like the smell in a smoking room, so I called downstairs to be moved. They said they didn't have anything else available. Now, I looked out the window and based on the number of cars in the parking lot and the size of this place----I found that hard to believe. I travel ALOT and my guess was probably 1/2-2/3 occupancy. So about a 1/2 hour later I called from my cell phone and asked about getting a room that night (non-smoking room). Of course they said there WAS a room available. So I called downstairs again and tried to get a new room. Same story..nothing available.....yeah right!!! So they like to play games with people here. In addition to the unpleasantness of having to deal with the smell in this room, there was also just one very small garbage can. I spoke to some other guests and they said they had the same situation. So I had to put trash on the floor. Nice, huh?? There were no extra garbage cans according to the desk. Garbage was piled up in the room near the ice machine and vending machines probably due to this going on in the rooms.
reviews.title: Don't go there unless u pay small bucks then expect bad service with breakfast

reviews.text: There are other hotels that aren't far from this one....DON'T BE FOOLED...this one is bad!!!
reviews.title: pleasant stay
Nice but overpriced
reviews.text: The continental breakfast is adequate with muffins, bagels and waffle makers. The hotel is located close to Broward shopping Mall with all the usual stores, and also a large amount of smaller stores and restaurants in the Fountains which is within walking distance of the hotel, very handy if you dont mind crossing a couple of small roads. Stromboli's is a pizza, pasta and of course stromboli restaurant/takeaway situated in The Fountains. It is worth a visit to listen to the man who works there who is very amusing, and the food is good too, very good value.

reviews.title: Quiet and comfortable
reviews.text: I almost forgot to mention Sawgrass Mills a large outlet shopping mall which is a shoppers paradise with too many shops to mention , check out their website. I recommend this hotel and will stay at this hotel again when I visit Ft Lauderdale.
This La Quinta is located in a nice and quiet area of western Broward County. The room is spacious and clean. The service personnel are friendly. I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: We were with a group of three other families. It is a comfortable place, and nice staff. Breakfast is a ok, but inadequate toasters, and other implements.
reviews.title: Nice quit location, good size rooms, start showing it's age.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Caution: Even after paying our bills, my credit card was billed for three rooms, for three days each. After clearing that up by phone, another family member received additional room charges for no reason.
reviews.title: Wonderful Inexpensive Hotel

likes.liked: — Roomy and clean, nice feel to the room
likes.disliked: — Breakfast could have a little more selection but was good.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel Labor day weekend. It is located next to a quiet office park and is a great choice for the traveling professional. Just two blocks from University Dr. and plenty of shopping, restaurants etc.
reviews.title: fantastic stay

reviews.text: Our room was very comfortable, extremely clean and roomy. We had the king size room with fridge and microwave
reviews.title: Great location for our needs, clean, quiet - as described by website

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times previously, first time about 6 years ago and previous stays have always been good. This time the hotel had lost its sparkle, the room allocated was on the ground floor and stank of tobacco smoke when we advised the reception they told us on 4th floor rooms were for smokers. This smell remained throughout our stay and it appeared to be coming in through the bathroom ventilation, not very good.
reviews.title: Lost its sparkle

reviews.text: The breakfast was okay, but there were occasional shortages of foods, beverages.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the last day I moved the bed forward to check nothing had fell behind it, only to find lots of old papers, plastic, fluff and hair which had clearly been thee some time, I guess the cleaners don,t clean behind the bed?
reviews.title: GREAT PRICE, FANTASTIC NIGHTS SLEEP!
Will stay again
reviews.text: The business centre was closed computer broken during our stay, no indication when it was going to be fixed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel in good location not far from turnpike and handy for the shopping malls, the pool area not big but nice, not sure I would stay again unless future reviews indicated a significant improvement.
reviews.title: A++++ The Best

reviews.text: The staff was very pleasant upon checking in. This is a nice, clean hotel in a great location. The rooms were clean and well maintained. This hotel is within a 2 block walking distance of at least 12 restaurants, a small movie theatre and 5 blocks from two huge malls. I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am truly surprised to see the positive review. The only thing I can say that was positive was my interactions with their employees. My friend and I stayed at this hotel after returning from a cruise. I had stayed at the La Quinta closer to FLL airport once before and had a good experience. Since I used to live in Miami, however, I opted for a hotel that would be a little closer to my friend's location. We didn't check in until late in the evening after spending the day with friends. I was really impressed with the young man at the front desk.
reviews.title: Were These People in the Same Hotel?

reviews.text: Initially walking into the room - it seemed really nice. It was very spacious. But after a few minutes I couldn't help but notice a filthy bathroom, dirty carpets, cheap sheets and a lot of evidence of wear and tear. I put a towel on the bottom of the bathtub because I didn't want to touch the surface with bare skin.
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.text: Because this stay was on a week night shortly after the holidays; the hotel appeared to be almost deserted. However, as I was trying to drop off to sleep, it became obvious that they had put people with a large, barking dog in the room right across from ours.
reviews.title: Adequate for one person--get a suite for more space and a computer electric plug.

reviews.text: Although the hotel was affordable - it is not a value when you're afraid you will get bugs in your luggage or athlete's feet from the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great night's stay!

reviews.text: Nothing terrible to say about La Quinta. The price was one of the best we could find for the area, so as expected (I think we paid around $90 for a room with two double beds), it wasn't top of the line. Breakfast was the usual toast and dry cereal (they did have a waffle maker that had a line during the weekend days). The lobby area had some outdoor eating areas which was on the way to the pool. The pool area was fairly nice, one small part of cracked cement around the edge but nothing you would get hurt on. The hot tub was nice in the morning with cooler temperatures. The fitness center was several treadmills and a multi-purpose machine, all out dated.
reviews.title: Decent Place for a Great Price!!!

aka: La Quinta Inn And Suites Plantation Hotel Plantation
